answers.answer: I had GD with my last pregnancy. We tried to control it with diet but it didn't work. I was put on insulin injections. Not fun but we do what we have to do! As a result of the GD, I had low amniotic fluid that was caught via routine u/s at 36 weeks and was induced at 37 weeks. Thankfully, baby was fine. She had jaundice and temp control issues but was otherwise ok.

I had it with my first.  It was controlled with diet.  I was told that the sugar I can't process will likely be processed by my baby and, as a result, my baby has a good chance of being large and also very thick in the trunk.  I was told that this could result in difficulty giving birth vaginally (head can deliver and trunk get stuck).Because my doctor felt my baby was getting big, he tried to induce my labor about a week early.  My labor failed to progress and I ended up having a c-section.  My doctor said he was very glad it ended up that way because my baby was already 9 pounds and thick in the trunk.   He also needed to be monitored and given sugar water to regulate his glucose levels.I'm not trying to scare you, just emphasize the importance of seriously keeping it under control.

i have gd and i'm on meds to control it  and i have to watch what i eat but now that i take glyburid(sp)it has been alot better my numbers are good. i'm 34 weeks and baby already at 5 lbs 10 oz as for anyother probs not sure yet goodluck

my doctor said if i fail the test wednesday i will have glyburide to take to control it. they warn me of big babies and that it could cause delivery issues. also that they could be born with low blood sugar(which can usually be fixed pretty quick)*on pins and needles*

question: Well I think I included this in my last update. I finally caught it. I caught my blood sugar going sky high. As high as 216.... not good at all. It makes me worry about my baby. My doctor said we are probably going to have to put me on some kind of medicine to control it..... since it's not because I'm pregnant or the way I'm eating. It's cause of the amount of steroids I have to take. Those of you who were/are diagnosed with gestational diabetes... What did your doctor do? What effect did this have on your baby? Did you get put on medicine for it? Just let me know what you ladies went through. It is appreciated. Thanks. By the way I'm 30wks....Also is it just me or what?? But I'm 30wks and I feel like I have a big basketball in front of me. I have problems getting up off the couch, bed already. I'm not even comfortable sitting. It sucks!! I feel so miserable.
title: Gestational diabetes ?'s and am I alone?
